title: Solihull
summary: Solihull (/ˈsɒlihʌl/, /ˈsoʊl-/ or /ˌsoʊliˈhʌl/) is a large market town and the administrative centre of the borough of Solihull in the West Midlands County, England. The town had a population of 123,187 at the 2011 Census.[1] Historically in Warwickshire, Solihull is situated on the River Blythe in the Forest of Arden area. It is the largest town in, and seat of, the Metropolitan Borough of Solihull, which has a population of 214,909.[2]
